page.title: 01Modern day Glastonbury
page.content: Situated in central Somerset is the delightful market town of Glastonbury. It is a town steeped in history and as such attracts many tourists. Many visitors climb the 500 feet to the summit of the{Tor,}and are reward- ed by views of the Wiltshire Downs to the East, to the North are the Mendip Hills, the Bristol Channel lies West and South are the Polden Hills. The {N.T.,}responsible for upkeep of the Tor, are in the process of making stepped pathways to prevent further erosion. {Market day}is Tuesday. Farmers bring cattle and sheep to the Livestock market and in the adjacent car-park there is an open-air retail market. {Tor Fair}held annually in September is a centuries old tradition. Farmers would bring their sheep for sale and enjoy a day at the Fair.
